name: Omnipresent Group
slogan: Omnipresent makes it easy to employ, pay and support your international team
description:
We're building a network of legal entities across the globe and an automation-focused tech platform to create the premier global employment-as-a-service offering on the market.

Over the past several months, as the entire knowledge economy has been forced into remote working due to the ongoing global coronavirus pandemic, the size of our market has undoubtedly increased by an order of magnitude. We’re moving at the speed of light to take advantage of this massive opportunity and we hope you’ll consider joining our mission to make global cross-border employment easy.

jobs.title: International Payroll & Finance Lead
jobs.description:
Remote work is one of the great equalisers of our time, allowing people to secure employment opportunities from companies around the world, no matter where they were born or where they live.

Yet, at a time when remote work is exploding, most companies are finding it operationally too complex, as well as prohibitively costly, to employ workers internationally. At Omnipresent, we’re centralising this complexity for our clients and offering them, and their remote workers, a simplified, cost effective and legally compliant employment experience. With a network of legal entities across the world, coupled with an automation-focused tech platform, we’re building the premier global employment-as-a-service offering on the market.

We're searching for an operations lead with deep expertise in international payroll and finance, including experience establishing multi-currency payroll operations across the globe. As our first ops team hire, in addition to your core payroll and finance responsibilities, you'll influence the design, testing and rollout of all of our operational processes, as well as drive standardisation and efficiency as we expand to more and more countries.

**Things You’ll Do**

As we rapidly expand into new territories, you’ll be responsible for setting up, centralising and automating our international payroll and finance functions across many jurisdictions. Specifically, you’ll:

- Establish payroll operations in a global multi-branch organisation
- Handle complex multicurrency transactions and reconciliations
- Set up and manage automated invoicing systems
- Source, assess and manage suppliers, including accountancy and payroll providers
- Automate all of our workflows by working closely with our tech team and suppliers
- Constantly work to solve novel problems against tight deadlines

**Requirements**

- Proven history of solving complex operational issues by building simple processes
- Experience establishing multi-currency payroll operations across the globe
- A strong understanding of multi-jurisdictional payroll and finance compliance
- Experience establishing corporate operations across multiple jurisdictions, including payroll and invoicing process
- Experience collaborating with suppliers and tech teams to automate processes
- A self-driven problem solver, with the ability to work towards achieving overarching goals with minimal direction. We're looking for a doer, not a talker and above all else, we need a team player

**Benefits**

- Working with an innovative and rapidly growing startup team
- Work from anywhere
- 25 days holiday allowance per year

jobs.title: Senior Legal Counsel - International Expansion
jobs.description:
Remote work is one of the great equalisers of our time, allowing people to secure employment opportunities from companies around the world, no matter where they were born or where they live.

Yet, at a time when remote work is exploding, most companies are finding it operationally too complex, as well as prohibitively costly, to employ workers internationally. At Omnipresent, we’re centralising this complexity for our clients and offering them, and their remote workers, a simplified, cost effective and legally compliant employment experience. With a network of legal entities across the world, coupled with an automation-focused tech platform, we’re building the premier global employment-as-a-service offering on the market.

Having recently secured seed funding we’re looking to ramp up operations globally, so there couldn’t be a more exciting time to join us. We're searching for a Senior Counsel with a strong operational mindset and an ability to continually resolve complex legal and commercial matters as we scale across the globe, independently or by engaging local counsel. The ideal candidate will have experience in a relevant area of business law but, more importantly, will have the aptitude and desire to take ownership of a far broader range of work such as international company formation, cross-jurisdiction tax regulations, employment and trust law.

**Things You’ll Do**

- Lead legal aspects of company formation in foreign jurisdictions in addition to managing ongoing filing and record-keeping requirements
- Obtain appropriate jurisdictionally-specific legal advice and manage external counsel where necessary
- Own all of our legal documents, including master service agreements and local employment contracts
- Advise upon cross-jurisdictional tax regulations (including transfer pricing)
- Draft, review and negotiate a wide range of commercial contracts
- Horizon-scanning, especially for notable regulatory developments
- Other general corporate advisory work
- Work with our tech team to develop a digital contract platform
- Solve many unforeseeable issues, legal or otherwise, as they arise

**Requirements**

- 3+ years’ PQE gained in a highly-regarded law firm advising clients both domestically and internationally
- Prior experience in a relevant area of practice (e.g. Corporate/M&A, Commercial, Tax, Employment, Litigation or Regulatory)
- Solid understanding of company law including the establishment of entities in foreign jurisdictions
- Supporting corporate operations across multiple jurisdictions, ideally including set-up and entry into new markets/territories
- Good understanding of multi-jurisdictional compliance 
- Excellent legal and commercial acumen

Finally, you must be a self-driven problem solver, with the ability to work towards achieving overarching commercial goals with minimal direction. We're looking for a doer, not a talker and above all else, we need a team player who wants to be part of a fast growing startup.

**Benefits**

- Working with an innovative and rapidly growing startup team
- Work from anywhere in the world
- 25 days holiday allowance per year
- Equity share option
